intro: Pterocyclus wolffianus, commonly known as the Wolffian pterocyclus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a shrub native to certain regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and are arranged in inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a moderate growth habit.
